reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you expect any peace and quiet, forget it, the giant ferry ran its engine about 100 yards from my room all night and the 7 AM departure made for exceptional noise from 5 am on.
reviews.title: do not expect to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I got no sleep even with earplugs and noise cancelling headphones. The room was new, clean and tiny, very tiny. Internet did not work. There is nothing around the hotel and the restaurant is OK but way overpriced.
reviews.title: They had thought of everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was lovely. The room was decorated to a high standard, the bed was very comfortable. They seemed to have thought of all the little luxuries, like very nice toiletries and a fridge with drinks in it. (She said she is planning on putting chocolate and pringles in it too so don't worry ladies there will be chocolate too).
reviews.title: James Stocks - Genius Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was also a fantastic choice with three types of fish or a typical Scottish breakfast.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTE CARNAGE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I thought the hotel was really lovely and was well worth the very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Refreshingly different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thumbs up to this all round excellent boutique Hotel in Tarbert on the Isle of Harris. On their website they promise: .... "all the things you would expect to find when staying at an intimate boutique hotel. Sublime comfort , top quality beds, great food, late breakfasts and checkouts, an excellent range of drinks and friendly staff all under one roof." ..... and that is exactly what you get ! (They forgot to mention that the hotel's decor is 5-star also. Really tastefully done.)
reviews.title: An excellent find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A most enjoyable stay that I can highly recommend.
reviews.title: first class

reviews.text: stopped by just for lunch in november . what nice little modern hotel. will bee back

reviews.title: What a transformation

reviews.text: cumbria
reviews.title: Surprisingly great hotel in tiny Tarbert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The head chef in this hotel was outstanding, unfortunately you could tell when he was not on! The service varied from the lack of customer service skills of the male owner, to the hair twirling antics of some of the staff to the friendlienss and efficency of the irish chap in the restaurant (a different chap from the chef) and efficency of the female owner who seemed to be the only capable manager on site. A great hotel and food that wowed that was let down consistently by some and I emphasise only some of its people.
reviews.title: As stated before, great hotel shame about the owner and bar staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Hebrides is located right by the ferry in Tarbert and could not be more convenient. The Tarbert carpark is right outside and is free! The hotel is the real gem of the town. The rooms are well designed and the toiletries made locally and of a very high quality. The staff are extremely friendly and are willing to spend time talking to guests in a very engaging manner.
reviews.title: The Fantastic Restaurant is a Must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the bar is exceptionally cheap and of the highest quality. Try the local Hebridean ale.
reviews.title: Fab location, great hotel, excellent food, lovely room, some staffing issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a table in the restaurant for our evening meal and I was very pleasantly surprised. It is as good as any flashy metropolitan restaurant on the mainland. We had the locally sourced scallops that were exquisitely cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. Even if you are not staying in Tarbert you should try the restaurant. It also opens at lunchtime. Make sure you book in advance in high season.
reviews.title: Never Again !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited the Hotel Hebrides with my husband in July 2010. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location, overlooking the harbour/ferry terminal. As stated in some of the previous reviews, the sound of the ferry engine can be heard early in the morning - but I am a light sleeper and it didn't sour my experience at all. The room we booked (deluxe double) was spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. The decor was modern, attractive and the entire room/hotel were spotlessly clean. The quality of food was outstanding and excellent value for money e.g. beautiful lamb shank for about £8.
reviews.title: boutique highland hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our chosen hotel on Harris was unable to accommodate us for the first day of our stay, and not being able to get a room at either of the other two hotel/guest houses that were suggested, we booked a room at the Hebrides Hotel.
reviews.title: Don't do it, you won't like it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived around lunchtime, but were told if we wanted to check in then we would need to pay extra. We returned in the late afternoon, to be told that there was a problem with the room. Despite having booked some weeks before, having given all our contact details and having been to Reception once that day, the staff waited until this point to tell us that our £150 room wasn’t available and they were putting us in the room above the kitchen. They ‘generously’ offered £20 discount, admitting that 'some' people found the kitchen extraction fan noisy. We went to look at the room, while I tried to phone around to find a room at a reasonable hotel without success. We asked for another room, but were told that was not possible. The manager assured us that the kitchen shut at 10pm and all would be quiet then. Some chance! The fan was loud, to the degree that the vibration could be felt through the floor. As it was, we had to go to Reception at 10.40pm and ask them to turn the fan off. (No phone in the room, apparently they were being put in – just what you generally expect from a boutique hotel). I have included a photo of the fab view from this room – classy!
reviews.title: Great Food, Good lodgings, warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to have a bath, but by the time my partner ran his, the water from the hot tap was more tepid than hot!
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel on Scottish Western Isles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar had some kind of live music on, which went on until midnight and as the walls are paper thin, there was no sleep to be had. This was particularly unfortunate as we had to be up very early to meet our boat for a day trip to St Kilda – but we needn’t have worried about sleeping in – the ferry that berths incredibly close to the hotel helpfully has some kind of warning horn when it opens its bow doors to load. No danger of over sleeping here! So we took our revolting packed breakfast (for those who leave early) and left with an enormous sense of relief.
reviews.title: Just a few wee things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel does have a useful information folder in which it is stated that it was a motel, but has since been upgraded and tellingly reveals that the owner married a marketing graduate. I would say that the marketing of the Hotel Hebrides is the only successful thing about it. It claims to be a boutique hotel, but do not be fooled, it is very clearly a former motel with a poor cosmetic makeover, which is in places is already showing wear (furniture in our room was already badly chipped as in picture). There was also a pile of empty cardboard boxes left in the corridor.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay - will be back
